snippet: The chief executive and managing director of the Brooklyn Philharmonic asks why audiences at classical music concerts should not be allowed to clap and cheer in the middle of performances.
abstract: Richard Dare, the chief executive and managing director of the Brooklyn Philharmonic, publishes article in The Huffington Post arguing that audiences at classical music concerts should be able to clap and cheer in the middle of the performances in order to liven up the shows.
lead_paragraph: The chief executive and managing director of the Brooklyn Philharmonic asks why audiences at classical music concerts should not be allowed to clap and cheer in the middle of performances.

headline.seo: Cheers and Claps at Classical Performances
headline.main: A Loud Call for Cheering at Classical Concert Halls
headline.print_headline: A Loud Call for Cheering at Classical Concert Halls
